title: Thunderbird 102.11.0 won't connect to Microsoft 365 SMTP
content:
Every time I try to send mails using my Microsoft365-Account, Thunderbird 102.11.0 fails to connect to the SMTP server at smtp.office365.com. Trying to set a new password from the dialogue just leads to the very same error message without enabling me to change or set a new password, leaving me stuck with the situation.

IMAP works fine and as intended.

Things I've tried so far:

  • Disabling IPV6 for all connections
  • Deleting OAuth-Tokens and allowing Cookies from https://login.microsoftonline.com by default
  • Using the newest Thunderbird Public Beta

All leading to the same warning, that my Login attempt for smtp.office365.com with user name abc@xyz.de has failed.

I've run out of options and leads. Any advice is appreciated.

title: UTC in calendar timezone
content:
Hi!

Is there some way to set the calendar time zone to UTC+0?

title: Move email branch with sub-structure
content:
I am trying to move email from one account to another. The email is in a folder structure which I would like to preserve. I would like to avoid having to recreate the folder structure by hand on the target; that would be very time consuming. I have been experimenting with a small nested set of folders before moving on to the real problem.

My first thought was to drag and drop the top level folder to local folders. First I checked that I could do it one folder at a time - no problem. If I try with a top level folder with sub-structure it only works if I specify that all sub folders are to be held locally. There is no way to mark a whole branch for local storage (that I have found), so that is a bit tedious running down the folder list ticking. So question 1: is there a better way.

Then I want to drag and drop from the local folders to the second account. For a single folder this works. For my small test folder with sub-structure it does not work.

It may be significant that the IMAP server for BOTH accounts (same server) does not support folders with both messages and sub-folders; the option "Server supports folders that contain sub-folders and messages" is therefore unticked for both accounts. I wonder if the information that a specific folder only contains sub-folders is lost in the move.

I then tried the ImportExportTools-ng plug-in. That suffered pretty much the same problem. I could export (same synchronise issue as above). I could import the result to Local Folders, but I could not import the same data to my target account.

I would be grateful for any other ideas.
creator: steve538

creator: raylight675

title: Thunderbird failing to fetch certain messages
content:
I use Thunderbird to access my mailbox via IMAP and have been doing so for many years so I am baffled by this issue. A mail sent to both me and my wife (separate mailboxes with the same provider) a couple of days ago never arrived in my Thunderbird inbox, even though it was successfully delivered - I can see it using a webmail client, and with another IMAP client on Android (Aquamail). My wife also uses Thunderbird, and it happily retrieved her copy of the message. I asked her to forward it to me but the forwarded message also failed to arrive in Thunderbird. Thinking it must be something on my computer (Linux, as is hers) I installed Evolution on the same machine. That happily retrieves the original message and all the forwarding attempts.

I can only assume there's something particular about this message that is causing Thunderbird to treat it (and all forwards containing it) somehow to be treated differently from others on my machine. I'm getting no visible errors or warnings, and the messages don't seem to be moved to another folder (spam, junk or whatever) as far as I can see.

Any suggestions how I can work out what's going on? It's disconcerting to know that some messages can simply not show up in Thunderbird and on other occasions I might be completely unaware of it.

SteveR.
creator: codesmith

title: How do I change email accounts using POP to IMAP/SMTP?
content:
I have six email accounts. Three of them do not allow me to delete emails. When I checked with the support team of my computer(linux), I was told that the problem with the three accounts was probably the POP settings and that I would do better with IMAP settings. I tried to reconfigure the settings, but only resulted in being able to receive emails, but not being able to send emails. This is a disaster for me. When I changed the settings I could only change from the input POP to IMAP. The outgoing settings were not available. There used to be an SMTP window with all the outgoing settings for all the email accounts I have. Where is this window? I can't find it anywhere. I wish the designers would think about the changes they make and their effect on non-tech people.

Any help will be gratefully received.
creator: bdjim

title: Thunderbird Encrypting Email can't find Encryption Certificate on Linux Version  102.10.0 (64-bit)
content:
I recently updated my Thunderbird on Linux to 102.10.0 via Centos 7 Yum. Now for certain email addresses I am unable to send encrypted email. Thunderbird says: "Sending of the message failed. You specified encryption for this message, but the application failed to find an encryption certificate for xxx@xxx.xxx" However, I can see via the Account Settings and People certs that those Certs exists and are valid. Also, via command line reading the cert9.db and key4.db, the Cert for those users exist:

Certificate: 

   Data:        Version: 3 (0x2)        Serial Number: 363175 (0x58aa7)        Signature Algorithm: PKCS #1 SHA-256 With RSA Encryption        Issuer: "CN=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXC=US"        Validity:            Not Before: Thu Jul 07 00:00:00 2022            Not After : Sun Jul 06 23:59:59 2025        Subject: "CN=XXX@XXX.XXX - OU=XXX, OU=XXX, O=XXX

Anyhow, I noticed that the cert8.db and key3.db had older entries, and I move that file to a backup folder so Thunderbird is only using cert9.db and key4.db. Again, the cert exists and Thunderbird sees it with the GUI. I didn't have this problem previously. I did obviously try keeping the cert8.db and key3.db along with cert9.db and key4.db in the Thunderbird dir, but again, it appears Thunderbird has moved on to using cert9.db and key4db. Some users with Valid Certs work for sending encrypted emails and some users do not. BTW: The intermediate signing and root signing certs are all trusted.

Also, for this new Version, when I run the GUI Tool/Tab from Thunderbird -> Security -> View Certificates of Recipients the output shows Not found for any users, even for the users who I am able send an encrypted email to (like myself). I can send myself an encrypted email, but tool output shows as Status "Not Found" for even my own cert even though I can send an encrypted email and read the encrypted email to myself via Thunderbird.

Please advise.

Thanks in advance!
creator: mishra771

title: Secure connection failure / Thunderbird failed to find the settings for your email.
content:
Hi, I've been having trouble with Thunderbird for a few days now.

I recently turned on and updated my laptop, which shares the same thunderbird accounts as my desktop. I had to update Thunderbird and log back into my google accounts because it had been some time since I last used that device. I noticed that I wasn't receiving emails on my desktop anymore. I did some research and tried applying fixes that I read online.

So far I've tried: Deleting my saved passwords > didn't work Removing the account entirely and re-adding it > Thunderbird failed to find the settings for your email account. Uninstalling Thunderbird and deleting any saved profile data > Same as above.

I did install a new router, a Netgear Nighthawk but I'm not sure if this is the cause of my trouble as both my mother's PC and my Laptop use Thunderbird. Both continue to work.

I use Kaspersky for my AV / security but all three machines also use Kaspersky and I've no issues on two of the three.

I'm currently running TB ver 102.11.0 (64 bit).

Any assistance and clear instructions would be greatly appreciated.

Cheers
creator: authurious85

title: Thunderbird Coloured Tags not syncing with other computers after changing to new OUTLOOK 365 servers
content:
Hi Guys I have a big Problem I have a team of about 5 computers that we use the thunderbird mail client and we used to have the emails servers with a Cpanel servers for emails ... they have had problems so we went for a "Microsoft outlook 365" email service to host/run the servers for our emails BUT !!!

We run 5 computers and rely of the TAGs that we can use to show the other 5 computers which emails have been looked at and/or needs looking at or been sorted by using the colours available (12345 standard colours and we DONT use custom tags)

Since we had to move we had to upgrade the Thunderbird to the latest version (102.101.011 32bit/64bit) and also there was this new 2 factor authentication to deal with Office365 which had its own problems which included having to disable smtp authentication in the Admin centre in order to make it all work

Now the emails send and receiver perfect BUT the coloured tags no longer auto sync : SO eg. when we change say an email from "john doe" on one computer Red tagged they stay black on all other computers which is causing MAJOR issues in our computer systems

We have only been testing this on 2 computers at the moment as they are next to one and other

Computer 1 system = Processor AMD Ryzen 3 2200G with Radeon Vega Graphics 3.50 GHz Installed RAM 8.00 GB (6.93 GB usable) System type 64-bit operating system, x64-based processor Edition Windows 10 Home Version 22H2 OS build 19045.2965 Experience Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.19041.1000.0 THUNDERBIRD VERSION =(102.101.011 32bit)

Computer 2 system = Processor Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-10400 CPU @ 2.90GHz 2.90 GHz Installed RAM 8.00 GB System type 64-bit operating system, x64-based processor Edition Windows 10 Home Version 21H2 OS build 19044.2846 Experience Windows Feature Experience Pack 120.2212.4190.0 THUNDERBIRD VERSION =(102.101.011 64bit)


These worked fine with syncing tags up until we upgraded the thunderbird and moved our servers to the new office365(outlook) servers

CAN SOMEONE PLEASE !! HELP ! Thanks in advance !!
